title: Metal spoon in cup of hot cocoa

content.question: When one end of a cold metal spoon is placed upright in a cup of hot cocoa, the other end eventually gets warmer. On the scale of the molecules of the spoon, which of the following is the primary explanation of this phenomenon?

choices.label: Higher-energy molecules will, on average, rise to the top.
The hot molecules produce thermal radiation that is then absorbed by the colder molecules.
Higher-energy molecules hit lower-energy molecules and, on average, tend to reduce the difference in temperature between the ends of the spoon.
Thermal energy is a fluid that flows from high concentration (hot areas) to low concentration (cold areas).

content.answer: Higher-energy molecules hit lower-energy molecules and, on average, tend to reduce the difference in temperature between the ends of the spoon.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
